And whoever obeys Allah and His Messenger has certainly attained a great attainment.} [Al-Ahzab: 70-71]. Indeed, the most truthful speech is the Book of Allah Almighty, and the best guidance is the guidance of Muhammad, peace and blessings be upon him. The worst of matters are newly invented ones, and every newly invented matter is an innovation, and every innovation is misguidance, and every misguidance is in the Fire. To proceed: Allah has obligated in His Noble Book, and His Messenger (peace and blessings be upon him) in his purified Sunnah, upon every Muslim to perform the ritual of enjoining good and forbidding evil. Legal texts have combined in this regard to emphasize the importance of this ritual and its great value to Allah, the Exalted, to the extent that some scholars counted it as a pillar of Islam, counting them as six pillars instead of five (1). For this reason, scholars, past and present, have paid attention to this great ritual, clarifying its principles and explaining its foundations.

text: The contemplator of our contemporary reality clearly notices some of that deviation in the true jurisprudence of how to forbid evil, where zeal for the prohibitions of Allah has overwhelmed and exceeded the legitimate limit that Allah Almighty is pleased with. Its proponents have transgressed into extremism not governed by Sharia or reason. The result of this was terrorist acts involving destruction, bombing, killing, and intimidation. This matter obligates students of knowledge, scholars, thinkers, and writers to play their role in confronting these deviant ideas and clarifying their misguidance to cut off the roots of corruption and mischief. Perhaps one of the strangest things a contemplator sees regarding these contemporary events and the reactions accompanying them is the accusation by some that the call of Sheikh Muhammad bin Abdul-Wahhab is involved in fueling such deviant thought and that it is a cause for its emergence. This shows clear ignorance of the reality of the Call and the positions of its Imams regarding such acts. Perhaps whim plays a major role in such accusations. Reasons for choosing the topic: 1- To clarify the efforts of the Imams of the Salafi Call in Najd in fighting extremism and excess and the terrorism that follows them, and that their positions regarding this are strict positions that do not accept transgression in this regard.

The researcher will focus on what the Imams of the Call, both scholars and rulers, wrote, analyzing their statements and deducing their scientific methodology in that regard. Research Methodology: The researcher will use the analytical deductive method in this research, collecting the texts reported from them regarding the issue of forbidding evil and what relates to it, then analyzing their statements and studying them carefully, deducing their methodology in this important issue. This will be according to the following steps: 1- Collecting available letters of the Imams of the Salafi Call in Najd and the books concerned with collecting those letters and their writings, and extracting texts related to the topic from them. 2- Conducting an analytical study of the collected texts related to the research topic and deducing their methodology from them. 3- Focusing on what the Imams of the Salafi Call in Najd wrote themselves, rather than what was reported about them, to reach their methodology without intermediaries that might divert the research from its path. 4- Being careful to quote their phrases verbatim mostly in the topic to be realistic. 5- Attributing Quranic verses to their places in the Book of Allah.

text: Preface: A Brief Overview of the Salafi Call in Najd: In the middle of the twelfth century Hijri, in the village of Huraymila located in Najd, was the initial appearance of the activity of a revivalist call aimed at reviving true Islam in the minds and hearts of people. This was represented in reality by what Sheikh Muhammad bin Abdul-Wahhab (1) undertook in calling people to the principles of Islam, foremost among them the Tawhid (monotheism) of Allah and warning against associating partners with Him, as it is "the greatest obligation brought by the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him" (2), in which a great deviation had occurred, such that the deviation of the early polytheists seemed small compared to the polytheism of the later ones in certain matters, as ignorance and weakness of mind were combined in them, whereas the early ones had sounder minds than them (3).

text: Historians consider the meeting of Sheikh Muhammad bin Abdul-Wahhab and Prince Muhammad bin Saud in the year 1157 AH (1), and the blessed pledge that took place between them in Diriyah, as the practical starting point for the Saudi State in its first phase. It is also the actual launch of the Salafi Call in Najd, as from there the Call began to take on a distinct new character; appearing in its existence within an entity established upon it and for its sake, aiming to protect and spread it. From here, the Salafi Call in Najd began to take its distinctiveness. Contributing to its appearance and prominence were its Imams, represented by a group of rulers who succeeded in managing the crisis of affairs in the Saudi State, and scholars who had a prominent role in spreading the principles of the Call and its ideas which represent the principles and foundations of Islam. They also had an effective role in fulfilling the duty of intellectual protection for those great principles that represent the truth of Islam. These scholars are those who studied under Sheikh Muhammad bin Abdul-Wahhab; or under his students, and followed the same ideas and principles that the Revivalist Sheikh called to, whether they were his children and grandchildren or others.

text: The First Chapter: Fiqh (Jurisprudence) of What is Before Denial. First Demand - The Reality of the Doer of Evil: The scholars of the Salafi Call in Najd realized that it is very important for the one carrying out the ritual of forbidding evil to understand the reality of the doer of evil. This is because some may be overwhelmed by looking at the evil, its ugliness, and its violation of the command of Allah Almighty, then neglect to look at the fact that the doer of evil remains a Muslim; doing the evil does not expel him from the circle of Islam. This matter obligates the Muslim to deal with his brother according to what the legal texts have brought regarding interaction among Muslims with one another, in fulfillment of the rights Allah has legislated between them. For this reason, the directives of the scholars of the Call came to confirm and entrench this meaning; in calling for a balanced view of the sinner or doer of evil; taking into account the evil within him and the good within him. Not every sinner is devoid of all good. Therefore, the sinner and doer of evil is hated for the evil and disobedience within him, and loved for the good within him. It is not appropriate for a Muslim to make his hatred for the evil with him decisive and overruling the good with him so that he does not love him (1).

text: Because the Imams of the Salafi Call in Najd realized the gravity of the matter, and the probability—indeed the certainty—of it occurring from some extremists, they used to warn against the occurrence of such things and stand as an impenetrable barrier against transgression in this area. Perhaps one of the most prominent examples of this is the stance of Sheikh Abd al-Latif bin Abd al-Rahman Al al-Sheikh when he was appointed judge in Al-Ahsa in the year 1264 of the Prophetic Hijrah. He found there two men who had withdrawn from the Friday prayer and the congregation and declared the Muslims in that land to be disbelievers based on flimsy arguments and false doubts. Sheikh Abd al-Latif summoned them, exposed their doubts, refuted their misguidance, and responded to their claim that this was the belief of the Revivalist Sheikh Muhammad bin Abdul-Wahhab. He clarified to them that the Revivalist Sheikh does not declare Kufr except for that which Muslims have agreed upon declaring its doer a disbeliever after the establishment of proof and its valid delivery (1).

Perhaps there is no doubt that the actual practice of the duty of forbidding evil requires from the one performing it an understanding of the correct method of denial. Without this understanding, the goal is not achieved. This is a matter that has its important role in the success of the preacher. Perhaps among the most important things a Muslim must understand while forbidding evil are the following: First Demand - The Ruling if Denial Results in a Greater Corruption: What is meant here is that forbidding evil might result in the occurrence of a corruption greater than the evil itself. This is a known and witnessed matter. To perceive this matter in its reality, every Muslim must understand what the objective of divine legislation is, a matter which the Imams of the Salafi Call were concerned with. Sheikh Abd al-Latif bin Abd al-Rahman Al al-Sheikh says in one of his letters alerting to it: "The objective of legislation and commands is achieving interests and repelling corruptions as much as possible, and it may not be possible except by committing the lighter of two harms or missing the lesser of two interests. . . This is done by clarifying the truth regarding violations against rulers; such as encroaching on their authorities, thinking ill of them, or accusing them of atrocities and false charges; because that leads to praiseworthy consequences. One of the most dangerous things is encroaching on the authority of rulers and not hearing and obeying them, or acting without their permission (Iftiyat). There is no doubt that these matters have corrupting effects that destroy society as a whole and make the conflict internal. For this reason, the directives of the Imams of the Salafi Dawah in Najd came warning against this slippery slope, rebuking the one who fell into it, and advising him to return. I summarize it in the following: 1- The Imams of the Salafi Dawah in Najd followed the Salafi methodology in their call to Allah, that methodology stemming from the Book and the Sunnah.
